title: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park: Park Home
body: "I gave out the psalm and they have been singing to the tune ever since.”     - Samuel Slater  The Blackstone River powered America's entry into the Age of Industry. The success of Samuel Slater's cotton spinning mill in Pawtucket, RI touched off a chain reaction that changed how people worked and where they lived, and continues to reverberate across the nation to this day. Come visit and see how this revolution transformed the landscape of the Blackstone Valley and then the United States.                New Passport Book!   We invite you to take your park Passport Book and explore the Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park.        Blackstone Trip Itineraries    Full day, half day and one hour suggested itineraries for visiting the Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park        Park Newsletter   Check out our latest newsletter to see what is going on              Things To Do At The Park   The park is still in the planning stages, but there are things for visitors to do right now both within the park and valley        New National Park   On December 19, 2014 President Obama signed legislation to establish Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park        Beginnings of Industry in America   What makes the Blackstone River Valley so special? See how modern industrial America began here.            Valley Videos   Check out our videos on the four mill villages within the new park.            2016 Walkabout Schedule   Check out the 2016 Walkabout schedule.
